meanings.definition: To blow or come in light gusts.
meanings.sent1: The wind whiffed through the trees gently.
meanings.sent2: The breeze whiffed across my face on a hot day.
meanings.sent3: The playful wind whiffed my hat off my head.
meanings.sent4: The scent of fresh flowers whiffed through the open window.
meanings.sent5: I could smell the delicious aroma as it whiffed past me.

meanings.sent1: He whiffed at the ball and missed it completely.
meanings.sent2: The batter whiffed at the pitch and couldn't make contact.
meanings.sent3: The player whiffed at the ball comically, almost falling over.
meanings.sent4: The batter's swing whiffed through the air with no connection.
meanings.sent5: The crowd groaned as the player whiffed at yet another pitch.

meanings.definition: To fail to hit or make contact with something.
meanings.sent1: She whiffed the ball during practice and felt frustrated.
meanings.sent2: The tennis player whiffed the ball, losing the point.
meanings.sent3: The cat playfully whiffed at the toy but missed every time.
meanings.sent4: His hand whiffed past the fly, failing to catch it.
meanings.sent5: I whiffed the target with the dart, missing by inches.
